Job Description:
ABOUT US

FAST INVEST was recognized by The Silicon Review among the Top 50 Fastest Growing Companies of the year 2019. Recently, the company started expanding into the real estate industry. So this is an excellent opportunity for a Construction Manager to join our team and use your technical skills and knowledge to contribute to the success of new projects in the market. FAST INVEST has an intention to inspire people and be always ready to pursue bigger goals.

ABOUT YOU
You do not come to work for the sake of just working. You are passionate about real estate and what you do. Willingness to approach projects with a can-do attitude and create a process where one does not exist. Comfortable in a fast-moving, fluid environment. Your previous experience with construction projects in Norway is very important for us.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Ensuring completion of all projects and tasks on time with a passion for accuracy, responsiveness, and in line with the foreseen budget.
Managing multiple projects and tasks in an extremely fast-paced environment.
Supporting all aspects of internal and external project coordination and communication.
Communicating with Norwegian institutions, architects and planning the most efficient way of the construction process.
Searching for trustworthy and reliable construction subcontractors and negotiating with them.
Working with and foreign assigned contractors as well as internal departments ensuring delivery of accurate proposals and quotes.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with partners in Lithuania and Norway by being honest and flexible at the first point of contact.
Attending construction management meetings with potential and current contractors and following up on action items.
Managing risks associated with all projects and tasks – ability to elevate risks through the appropriate channel.

WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU
Previous experience with construction projects management in Norway. (SMILE SU SAUKTUKU(
Native Norwegian and Good English language skills (written and oral).
Thorough knowledge of the constructional and architectural processes and materials.
To understand all unique Norwegian-specific requirements that are associated with real estate development.
Ability to work with AutoCAD and BIM programs.
Ability to travel and work from Lithuania’s office.
Detail-oriented and strong organizational skills.

PERSONAL SKILLS
Independent thinker who will take ownership of assignments.
A team player soul looking for growth, both personal and business.
Ability to communicate concisely and clearly.
Curiosity!

WE OFFER
Professional development budget.
Flexible working hours and a special attention to work-life balance.
A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible.
International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment.
Many fun team events, office parties, and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues.

FAST INVEST is a P2P Investment platform where investing is made easy. Recently, our company was recognized by The Silicon Review among the Top 50 Fastest Growing Companies of the Year 2019. 545% growth of the investment volume, more than 33k customers from 55 countries .
We are committed to attracting and retaining the best team of talented professionals, and to create a better working culture where everyone can develop and use their best skills in the FinTech industry. By retaining leading talent anchored in a culture of integrity, we can operate according to our guiding principles and ensure excellent service and a healthy team environment.

About the role:
This is an exciting opportunity for talented, motivated and relationships driven person to join Fintech world as CEO assistant. You will work closely with the team leader and you will support her with day-to-day tasks. So your primary role will be to assist, plan everything and be always ready to do something unpredictable. This role requires high flexibility and the ability to answer your phone 24/7.

Your experience & skills:
You have a bachelor’s degree, preferably in finance-related fields.
You have experience working at Fintech or Tech company (it would be your superpower!).
You are very good at planning (ohh super good!).
You have excellent attention to detail.
You have perfect communication skills.
You are a team player with no ego.
Your English is fluent (both written and verbal).
You are loyal, trustworthy and superrrrr confidential.

Key responsibilities:
Support the CEO to ensure her diary management and execution, including arranging meals and ensuring everything is where it needs to be.
Creating a list of tasks and priorities for the CEO.
Manage and maintain calendars.
Schedule calls and meetings.
Manage a very busy inbox, highlight key emails, keep track of responses and any follow-ups required.
Participate in preparation for meetings, preparing papers and all required material.
Coordinate all travel arrangements (flight check-in, transportation to and from the airport, hotel, etc.).
Handle confidential information with integrity.
Deliver the operating rhythm to the team.
Build strong relationships across the organization.‍

Your superpowers:
Always ready for everything.
Superhero at planning.‍
There is not an impossible task for you.
Ability to travel the world more than one time per month.
You can find solution in the situation when it looks like where is no solution at all.
Thinking and doing everything really fast.
Can take care of everything and be everywhere.
Having an eye for stylish things and strong aesthetic.
...We are not searching for an unicorn, but close to it.

We offer:
Possibility to work with international projects and go across our offices in Europe.
Competitive salary and rewards based on achieved results.
Fancy offices in the Barcelona & Kaunas city center.
Multicultural environment.
Great work-life balance culture.
Team events and much more

All candidates must be eligible to work in Kaunas.

If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.

Our associates are a strategic advantage for us who are making a difference at Littelfuse. Join our team and make a difference every day!

Growing Lean team in Kaunas of 7 members, that works on Lean development have achieved great result and looking for Lean Manager to join Littelfuse.

You will be responsible for leading Lean methodology implementation based on Lean Roadmap also accountable for continuous improvement and efficiencies across the Company’s products, systems, operations and processes, to lead a team of people. You will work with the Management Team, develop, set the pace and implement business continuous improvement strategy with organizational structure, commercial approach, culture, people and processes.

About the job:
Apply the Lean Principals to the major processes across the plant to identify and remove waste, improve operational performance and create an environment of continuous improvement
Contribute to new business initiatives and projects and review and communicate the impact on Lean activities
Work collaboratively, negotiate and engage with key stakeholders to facilitate delivery and compliance with the Lean strategy
Develop key metrics to monitor progress during and after current state / future state implementation in order to insure favorable improvements are sustained
Develop and build a culture of engagement at all levels of the business to provide a highly energized team which is flexible to meet the changing needs of the business
Contribute to the creation and implementation of best practice Lean vision, strategy, policies, processes and procedures to aid and improve operational performance
About you:
3 to 5 years proven experience in LEAN environment
LEAN or 6-Sigma knowledge with experience in the delivery of Lean Training programs
Excellent leadership and people management skills
Ability to work with a variety of cross-functional team members
Competence in problem solving, team building, planning and decision making
Demonstrated high performance and commitment to continuous improvement
Fluency in English
Very good MS Office skills
Beneficial skills:
Green Belt or Black Belt certification
We offer:
The possibility to work in an exciting and challenging industry
Professional development opportunities to expand your knowledge through cross-functional collaboration and training experience

At TransferGo we believe transferring money globally should be as simple and easy as sending a text. We aim to make life easier for anyone sending money by removing the processes and fees that traditional banks and cash bureaus have.

We are a fast growing FinTech company with an international team of almost 200 employees with offices in London, Vilnius, Kaunas, Berlin, Istanbul and Warsaw, a great product available on both web and mobile (NPS 76; 4.8/5* TrustPilot), plus reliable customer service available in 50+ countries and now we are looking into expanding our product and growing customer base across existing and new markets.

Here’s what you’ll be doing:
You'll be responsible for executing transactions/processing refunds
Ensuring timely and accurate transactions processing
Investigating and assisting team in solving problematic payments
Independently investigating and communicating issues with banks and counter parties
Preparing information required by operational accounting and assisting in all matters
Working closely with the management and other operational departments on concerns and issues that arise in daily operations
Identifying any areas or processes of improvement
Assisting team with the daily workflow and ad hoc tasks
Requirements

Here’s what we’d love from our new Financial Operations Specialist:
Degree in Finance/Economics or related discipline
1-2 years of experience in finance operations
Ability to work on complex tasks with minimal supervision
Ability to multitask and deliver high quality results that meet the identified targets
Strong time management and attention to detail skills
Professional communication skills
Fluent and effective oral and written communication skills in English
Flexibility to work in different shifts, according to business needs
What we believe

At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way.

We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!

Benefits
Unlimited paid holiday
Latest equipment needed
Highly skilled team members
Access and licenses to latest tools and technologies
Guaranteed yearly training budget
Friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment (pet friendly office, team events, snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings and events)
Private health insurance (after 6 months of employment)
Monthly salary from 1500 € to 1700 € (gross) depending on the level of experience.

We Make Life More Rewarding and Dignified

Responsibilities:
Evaluate, implement and improve manufacturing processes by creating prototypes, testing, making modifications or by observation and throughput analysis
Develop new projects with including cost-benefit analysis to effectively utilize equipment and materials to maximize production by studying product requirements and testing manufacturing methods
Troubleshoot process and production issues (e.g. production scrap), investigate problems and analyze root causes where these relate to production techniques that are used
Identify and lead Continuous Improvement Projects with emphasis on manufacturing cost reduction and capacity improvements/cycle time reductions.
Inspect performance of machinery, equipment, and tools to verify their efficiency, and investigate and initiate corrective action of problems and deficiencies to ensure product quality.
Prepare product and process reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Support Global Engineering Project / Process team to implement new equipment and upgrade projects
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering discipline, preferably Mechanical / Manufacturing Engineering or related field.
3 years’ of working experience in manufacturing environment, to include experience with development of automated production equipment.
Familiarity with Equipment Control systems, PLC’s, FMEA and PFMEA.
Familiarity with DOE, validation, and statistical analysis tools.
Ability to proactively identify and resolve engineering and manufacturing related issues.
Good analytical and problem solving skills, as well as a keen attention to details.
Project management, leadership and team work skills.
English and Lithuanian language required.
Company offers:
Professional development and career opportunities in new established manufacturing facility in Kaunas.
Opportunity to become a part of a reputable company and join their unique culture.
Attractive remuneration package.
Hollister is an Employee Owned employer

Apply Now!

Pernod Ricard is the world’s leader in the Premium spirits industry. It operates in more than 85 affiliates and 100 production sites all over the world. Pernod Ricard Lithuania is a part of Pernod Ricard Northern Europe. The company focuses on 15 key wine and spirits brands such as ABSOLUT, Jameson, Havana Club and Jacob’s Creek.

Overall responsibility:
Management and control of sales order processing – To control the process of getting Sales orders from customers, transferring them to 3PL, shipment of goods and invoicing.
Providing customer services – provide assistance to PR Lithuania customers through the whole Selling process, from getting the order to delivering goods and issuing the invoice.
Management of daily office routines – to organise daily office routines such as post, office supplies, control of IT service request etc.
Assistance to other departments - To establish and maintain good relationship with other Company’s departments and assist them upon request.
Requirements:
Excellent computer knowledge
Responsibility, self-discipline, accuracy, capability to meet the deadlines
Social skills and cross-cultural awareness
Ability to work in teams but also independently
Planning and organizing skills
1-2-year work experience in relevant area is an advantage
Lithuanian– fluent
English -very good
We offer:
Open corporate culture and organization wide opportunities for professional growth;
Salary 1300 -1400 Gross;
Interesting and challenging work;
Inspiring and competent team.
Job Posting End Date:

Target Hire Date:

2020-04-01-07:00

Target End Date:

Early Careers at PMI
Being at the beginning of starting your professional career is exciting, yet not always easy. We know that, as we have been through this too.
At PMI, many of us started our journey as curious and ambitious interns, expecting to broaden our professional horizons, gain knowledge & skills, develop professional network & have opportunities for an international exposure. It’s the perfect setting place to start your career. Interested to hear more? Then read further…

Your ‘day to day’

You will work on diverse, real-life situations and business projects. You will have a chance to master new skills, gain knowledge and new perspectives.
We offer opportunities within Digital, Marketing & Events and Legal functions.

Who we’re looking for

We hope that you have passion for what really matters: consumers, innovation, people and results. You are curious to learn & discover every day and have eager to deliver. You are also:
• A final year or recent University graduate.
• Fluent in Lithuanian & English languages.
• Have a valid Lithuanian work permit.

What we offer

• Employee centric, inspiring LEADERS, who will encourage you to make self-sufficient decisions, coach to reflect on different perceptions, guide in taking measurable risks and learn from your mistakes.
• Flexible & inclusive ENVIRONMENT, development oriented CULTURE, cosy office and amazingly collaborative colleagues, who will treat you as a valuable member of the team, provide honest & structured feedback, so that you can have a chance to reach your full potential.
• Prospect of making an IMPACT and deliver tangible business results, crediting with trust & supporting on the way, enabling to openly face FMCG sector trade realities & run real projects and business tasks.

To join our growing team apply until 12th April 2020 (preferably earlier).

All applications will be treated confidentially and screened on the on-going basis. The process consists of online tests, first round digital interviews, followed by face to face interviews with successful candidates.
Salary for this role is 823 EUR gross.
Competitors: British American Tobacco, Imperial Brands, Japan Tobacco International

Job Description:
Appen is an award-winning organization. Our people help leading technology companies expand into new global markets. With capability in over 180 languages, Appen’s global network of specialists and in-country virtual teams work together to ensure new products and technologies operate in all the languages our clients need. Whether our clients need help for in-vehicle speech recognition technology, improving search engine performance or building translation software, Appen delivers.
We are proud to have been named in Forbes Magazine as one of the Top 100 Companies Offering Flexible Jobs in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017.
We are looking for bilingual Lithuanian/English translators for an upcoming project.
Location: On-line
Estimated weekly hours: 15-20 hours
The Project:
The data (700,000 Lithuanian source words) to be translated have been taken from various online news sources in Lithuanian.
The translated data from this project will be used as training data to develop a machine translation engine.Hence, accurately conveying the meaning of the source text and naturalness in US English is very important.
Requirements:
Lithuanian and English native or near-native level speaker
Confident with US spelling conventions
Very good grammar and spelling skills in target language
Reliable Internet connection
Qualified candidates will be asked to complete a couple of tests.
Preferred Skills:
Professional translation experience and/or degree in translation or linguistics (or related field).
If you or someone in your circle of friends meet the requirements and is interested in contributing to this project, apply now!
Detailed project information and instructions will be provided shortly after you have enrolled.
Appen constantly seeks motivated freelancers to support their translation, transcription, annotation and data collection teams. Your successful contribution to this project will grant you a space in our database and a good chance to be considered for projects in the future.
We are looking forward to receiving your application.

If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.

Our associates are a strategic advantage for us who are making a difference at Littelfuse. Join our team and make a difference every day!

Digital Engineer

Growing Littelfuse Global IT, Analytics & Master Data department is looking for Digital Engineer to join newly formed team in Kaunas and accelerate Robotics Process Automation and Analytics cross-functionally, support business by providing the required capabilities of turning data into actionable insights and applying science to predict and model future outcomes. In this role you will collaborate with different business units to understand company needs and devise possible solutions.

About the job:
Extract information from various sources and analyze to understand how the business performs
Design, build, deploy and maintain Robotic Process Automations (RPA) with multi-application touch points
Present Artificial Intelligence (AI)/ Machine Learning (ML) outcomes to business via visualizations
Research and learn new and diverse set of technologies (RPA, Virtual Reality etc.) and identify potential use cases
Running machine learning tests and experiments, develop machine learning applications according to requirements
About you:
Bachelor’s degree in information systems, programming, statistics, business analysis or other computer science curriculum course which includes quantitative analysis
At least 1 year of similar job experience
Experience with Python/R is a must; experience with C#/.NET/Java is a plus
Working knowledge of Big Data, AI, ML technologies
Good understanding of data ETL process
High level of communication skills in English - written and verbal
Team player with ability to work in cross-cultural environment
Self-starter with strong learning capabilities and a data-oriented personality
Beneficial skills:
Working experience with relational databases and NoSQL
Experience with Tableau or MS- BI stack; developing, deploying and maintaining ML models and algorithms
Experience with team collaboration tools such as Jira, GitHub, Confluence, or Microsoft Teams
We offer:
Salary from 1350 eur/mon gross, excluding bonus based on performance. The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate.
The possibility to drive innovations in a highly global, flexible and results-driven environment, within an exciting and challenging global function
Professional development opportunities to expand your knowledge through training and cross-functional collaboration

Competitors: Surys Group, MarkMonitor, J Patton Sports Marketing

Job Title: Customer Support Specialist (Ukrainian or Russian speaker)
Job Description:
At TransferGo we are on a mission to make moving money globally as simple and easy as sending a text. We aim to make life easier for anyone sending money abroad by removing the processes and fees that traditional banking institutions have.

We are a fast-growing FinTech company with an international team of more than 170 employees, great product and service available in more than 50 countries, with the goal to provide the best customer service every step of the way.

Our Customer Support Team:

We believe that our customers deserve the best, so even if they face any issue or just have a question, we’re always ready to help. Currently, our team provides support in 9 languages and consist of more than 40 very dynamic, super-friendly and passionate individuals.

At the moment we are looking for a highly motivated and bright Ukrainian or Russian speaker to join our wonderful Customer Support Team in Vilnius, Lithuania. If you are a dynamic problem solver who enjoys communicating and helping others, and you’re as passionate about positive customer experience as we are, you have to join us!

Requirements
Excellent verbal, written & listening skills in Ukrainian or Russian.
Decent English for daily communication with the team and colleagues.
Passion for excellent customer experience.
Ability to master customer interactions, handle complaints and keep calm in stressful situations.
Ability to multi-task and take responsibility & ownership in challenging situations.
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to work effectively in a team: a friendly, empathic and solution-oriented person.
Flexibility to work in different shifts, according to business needs.
What we believe

At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way.

We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!

Benefits
Being part of extremely exciting and growing Fintech startup community
Competitive salary package.
Unlimited paid holidays.
Flexible working hours with opportunity to work from home.
Opportunity to learn with a company that is rapidly growing along with a guaranteed training budget of 1000 €.
Friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment (pet friendly office, team events, snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings, fund budget and events).
Private health insurance (after 6 months of employment).
Monthly salary from 1100 € to 1800 € (gross) depending on the level of experience.

Check out more about us on Company Page, Careers Page and Glassdoor.

We’re looking for a battle-tested Engineering Manager to lead our product team and to help us keep growing.

Our mission is to make moving money globally as simple as sending a text, by removing the processes and fees associated with traditional banking institutions. You’ll be joining a scale-up fintech company that has 140% YoY revenue growth, along with an international team of 170+ employees, a great product and a service that’s available in 50+ countries.

As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be managing, working with and coaching a team of experienced engineers, providing them with the context and tactical goals, architectural guidance, and day-to-day technical direction. You and your team will collaborate with business stakeholders to define product roadmap, goals and deliverables. Your work will directly impact the business day-to-day in tangible and visible ways. Your team will be fully owning a dedicated product domain, responsible for that end-to-end: full stack, full life-cycle.

Your work will be a balanced mix of hands-on software engineering, team management, and research - you will have a lot of space to contribute yourself, and to keep your technical competency sharp.

If you're excited to be part of a winning team, to work on a purposeful “pain-killer” product, to sharpen your technical leadership skills, and to level-up towards senior engineering roles (tech co-founder, VPE, etc.), it is a perfect place to get ahead.

You’ll be reporting to VP Engineering.

Here’s what you’ll be doing:
Leading an autonomous cross-functional technical team to build and improve exciting Fintech products.
Working with other teams both within the engineering organization and outside of it, in order to get a better understanding of user needs and the impact of work the team does
Providing context so team members can perform specific tasks
Helping people on the team grow professionally ensuring everyone's voice is heard and a wide range of people can be successful
Hiring great coworkers to join the team
Requirements

Here’s what we’d love from our new Engineering Manager:
Experience leading and guiding engineering teams (formally or informally; we care about your actual achievements, not titles)
Experience designing, building and running distributed software systems
Recent hands-on software engineering experience (this is a contributing manager role, you would need to get your hands dirty)
A generalist rather than a specialist - you're excited by experimentation and unblocking anything that stands in the way of success
A passion for efficiency and collaboration
And if you can also do these things, even better:
Financial industry experience, especially in a startup, would be helpful in this role - but is not required
Working knowledge with our tech stack would be a benefit (or ability to learn and ramp-up quickly)
Hands-on experience building cloud-native applications and services (we are AWS house)
Hands-on experience with incremental delivery, continuous integration, continuous deployment, coding for automated testing
What we believe

At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way.

We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!

Benefits

Some of our best benefits are:
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personalized professional development towards your next role on the technical leadership path
Awesome, highly skilled team members
Flexible time / flexible location
Unlimited paid holiday
Yearly training budget
Friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment (pet friendly office, team events, snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings and events)
Private health insurance (after 6 months of employment)
Monthly salary from 4000 € (gross) depending on the level of experience.

Kviečiame lietuvių kalbos specialistą (-ę) prisijungti prie mūsų pasaulinės Booking.com turinio agentūros.

Būsite atsakingi už Booking.com produktų (svetainės, programėlių, naujienlaiškių ir pan.) lietuviškos versijos kokybę bei komunikacijos turinį (televizijos reklamas, pranešimus spaudai ir kt.), skirtą įvairiems klientams mūsų versle.

Tikimės, kad jus ne tik domina kalbos ir lokalizavimo temos, bet jūs puikiai išmanote šią sritį, suprantate, ko reikia klientams, galite išlaikyti bei nuolat tobulinti mūsų produktų kokybę. Taip pat tikimės, kad stengiatės klientams teikti aukščiausius kokybės standartus atitinkančius produktus.

i laikina (12 mėn.) darbo visą dieną pozicija siūloma mūsų biure Vilniuje.

Atsakomybės
Lietuvos rinkai skirti patrauklūs ir kūrybiški svetainės bei rinkodaros turinio (taip pat naujienlaiškių) vertimai iš anglų į lietuvių kalbą
Lokalizavimo projektų įgyvendinimas kartu su kitomis kalbos specialistų komandomis ir įmonės departamentais
Laisvai samdomų vertėjų darbo organizavimas ir pagalba jiems: kandidatų vertimų kokybės vertinimas, laisvai samdomų darbuotojų vertimų kokybės stebėsena, argumentuotų ir nuoseklių komentarų apie atliktus darbus pateikimas
Booking.com sistemos lietuvių k. kokybės palaikymas atliekant svetainės patikrinimus, kuriant ir atnaujinant kalbos standartus apibrėžiančius įrankius (pavyzdžiui, glosarijų ir stiliaus gidą)
Pagalba įgyvendinant Booking.com B. V. paslaugų teikimo strategiją Lietuvoje

Reikalingi įgūdžiai
Aukštasis išsilavinimas susijusiose srityje
Nepriekaištingi lietuvių kalbos įgūdžiai (kalbėjimo ir rašymo), puikios anglų kalbos žinios
Vertimų ir (arba) lokalizuoto svetainės turinio, skirto Lietuvos rinkai, kūrimo patirtis
Susitelkimas į kliento poreikius
Darbo kompiuteriu įgūdžiai, įskaitant gebėjimą naudotis kompiuterio pagalba atliekamų vertimų įrankiais
Lankstumas, tikslumas, produktyvumas, patirtis dirbant su nustatytais užduočių terminais, prioritetizavimo ir analitiniai įgūdžiai, gebėjimas atlikti skirtingas užduotis vienu metu
Iniciatyvumas dirbant individualiai ir komandoje
Pozityvumas
Patirtis kelionių technologijų ir (arba) viešbučių / turizmo srityje
Socialinių tinklų turinio kūrimo, audiovizualinio lokalizavimo, Lietuvos rinkos tyrimų patirtis būtų laikoma privalumu.
Ką siūlome?
Dinamišką darbo aplinką ir kultūrą, kurioje vertinamas atvirumas, pažangios idėjos ir susitelkimas į darbo rezultatus.
Mokymus ir įvairias asmeninio tobulėjimo galimybes mūsų sparčiai augančioje įmonėje.

Just 2 years ago, Wolt operated in 4 countries and 10 cities across the Nordics. Fast forward to today, we’re in 20 countries and over 80 cities across EMEA, servicing over 4M registered users. We’re growing rapidly and are looking for more talented individuals to join us. If you are passionate about cutting-edge technology, great food, and making an impact in your city, then Wolt just might be for you.

About Wolt Lithuania’s operations
The role you are looking at is part of the Lithuania Operations Team of Wolt which is the heart and soul of Wolt Lithuania. Wolt is more than just a food delivery app - in fact we are a smooth operation built upon a solid foundation of state-of-the-art technology. We act as a real-time marketplace connecting customers, restaurants and courier partners. We collect a ton of data from multiple sources and make it actionable by tuning our operations. We want to make sure that we use all this data the best possible way, benefitting all our partners and customers.

About the Role
We're currently looking for Support Associates to join us at our Vilnius office! In our Support Team there is no typical day, and to be successful in our Support Associate role you will need to be self-motivated, creative, have strong analytical skills, and excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills to build strong communities of couriers, merchants and customers. As part of our team in Vilnius you’ll get to see all aspects of Wolt. Please note that the work is done in shifts.
Role Focus
Customer Obsessed: At Wolt, our Community OPS team knows that customer interactions serve a larger purpose than simply fixing problems; our mission is to provide customers with an out of this world and memorable experience, every time.
Team Oriented: Work with a diverse team of fellow Support Associates and liaise with our other team members in Lithuania (and sometimes in other Baltic countries) to ensure a smooth sailing operations in Vilnius.
Communication: Fluidly and fluently communicate with our courier partners, customers, and merchants and adjust your tone to your audience.
Personal Touch: We’re not afraid to play up the playfulness in our interactions, so creativity is a must!
Get stuff done: Hustle, hustle, hustle.
Your Background
You're in the final stages of your university studies or a recent grad looking to get your feet wet in a fast-paced startup environment.
You already have experience in a customer-facing role under your belt and you're excited to join our Support OPS team where you genuinely want to improve Vilnius’ food & tech scene.
You are a fast learner & good at multitasking as customer communication may happen through many different channels simultaneously.
You are a bit of a tech savvy and quick learner when it comes to operating multiple digital communication and monitoring systems, without losing overview.
You're an expert when it comes to Vilnius’ food scene, traffic patterns, and the different residential and commercial districts.
You have a can-do attitude and enjoy the idea of working in a fast-paced startup environment.
Fluent in Lithuanian and able to work in English.
You are comfortable adjusting your tone to your audience.
So if you are excited about working in a high growth environment, taking ownership and being part of an extremely high performing team, we’d love to hear from you! We are reviewing applications on an on-going basis, so send through your application ASAP :)

Please submit your application in English!

About Wolt
Wolt is a Finnish technology company and we’re best known for our food delivery platform. On our mobile app or website, customers can order their favorite meals from our restaurant partners, and either pick their order up or have it delivered by our courier partners.

We’re currently active in 20 countries and more than 80 cities, servicing over 4 million customers. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of seconds, in the customer’s own language.

We’ve raised more than €150M in financing from renowned U.S. and European based investors, such as ICONIQ Capital, 83North, EQT Ventures and Highland Europe. We've also been fortunate enough to receive some appreciation and recognition for our hard work along the way: Apple selected Wolt’s app as their Editors' Choice, Wired named the company one of the "Hottest Startups in Europe," Forbes included our CEO Miki Kuusi on its 30-under-30 in Consumer Tech list, and the Nordic Startup Awards named Wolt Company of the Year.

We Make Life More Rewarding and Dignified

Location: Kaunas
Department: Operations

Hollister Incorporated is an independent, employee-owned company that develops, manufactures, and markets products for ostomy care, continence care, and wound care and develops educational support for patients and healthcare professionals. We have been in business for more than 95 years. Our products are sold in more than 90 countries and we have manufacturing and distribution centers on three continents. At Hollister Incorporated, we are passionate about the work we do, and we are committed to making life more rewarding and dignified for our Associates and for the people who use our products and services. A career at Hollister Incorporated can take many paths, all of them leading to rewarding opportunities.

Early Careers at PMI
Being at the beginning of starting your professional career is exciting, yet not always easy. We know that, as we have been through this too.
At PMI, many of us started our journey as curious and ambitious interns, expecting to broaden our professional horizons, gain knowledge & skills, develop professional network & have opportunities for an international exposure. It’s the perfect setting place to start your career. Interested to hear more? Then read further…

Your ‘day to day’

You will work on diverse, real-life situations and business projects. You will have a chance to master new skills, gain knowledge and new perspectives.
We offer opportunities within Continuous Improvement & Operations Training, Engineering, Production, Quality Assurance and Supply Chain functions.

Who we’re looking for

We hope that you have passion for what really matters: consumers, innovation, people and results. You are curious to learn & discover every day and have eager to deliver. You are also:

• A 3rd – 4th year bachelor or master studies student in Technological, Physical or Social sciences or recent University graduate.
• Fluent in Lithuanian & English languages.
• Advanced in MS Office packages (Excel & PowerPoint).
• Have a valid Lithuanian work permit.

What we offer

• Employee centric, inspiring LEADERS, who will encourage you to make self-sufficient decisions, coach to reflect on different perceptions, guide in taking measurable risks and learn from your mistakes.
• Flexible & inclusive ENVIRONMENT, development oriented CULTURE, cosy office and amazingly collaborative colleagues, who will treat you as a valuable member of the team, provide honest & structured feedback, so that you can have a chance to reach your full potential.
• Prospect of making an IMPACT and deliver tangible business results, crediting with trust & supporting on the way, enabling to openly face FMCG sector trade realities & run real projects and business tasks.

To join our growing team apply until 12th April 2020 (preferably earlier).

All applications will be treated confidentially and screened on the on-going basis. The process consists of online tests, first round digital interviews, followed by face to face interviews with successful candidates.

Salary for this role is 823 EUR gross.
Competitors: British American Tobacco, Imperial Brands, Japan Tobacco International

Job Description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Revolut does Operations differently. The team sits at the core of Revolut, working with departments
across the business to help solve issues and create effective, scalable solutions.
Operations has been responsible for major milestones like launching Premium and building our
banking infrastructure, as well as saving millions of pounds for the business.
Working in Operations at Revolut will give you exposure to a range of different verticals, where you
will deep dive into the fundamentals of each business area you work on. This gives you breadth and
depth of experience unrivalled in almost any other job and offers you the chance to have a huge
impact on Revolut’s success.

ABOUT THE ROLE
If you are one the rare masters of your native language, are detail oriented, always push for perfection, and you understand the importance of speaking to customers like humans, then we've got the perfect role for you. We're looking for a hands-on and passionate Language Owners to climb on board and take the lead and ownership of one or more of our supported languages across all platforms (Website, App, Coms , ...). We've built an incredible brand, and we are one of the fastest growing technology startups in the world as a result.

THE LOCALISATION TEAM
Our Localisation team is responsible for translating all content into 28 different languages (and growing) on a daily basis. Whether it is for new product launches, communication or marketing, we strive for perfection with having one goal in mind, being the first truly Global Bank.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
• Own and perform quality checks on the localised content of your assigned language(s), having a direct impact on thousands of customers.
• Optimise the quality of the existing website, mobile app and communication content by designing a localisation framework and collaborating with our translating partners.
• Work with the latest versions of the App/Website on a daily basis and ensuring that we deliver the most outstanding localised platforms among Fintech's.
• Build efficient QC processes and we ensure that quality exceeds our customers’ standards

WHAT YOU’LL NEED
• NATIVE IN: French or Romanian or Polish (minimum requirement)
• Fluent in English
• Localisation, copywriting, or linguistic experience.
• Writing creative and engaging content is your bread and butter (we're not corporate)
• You are incredibly hands-on yet comfortable taking a step back and thinking strategically
• You are naturally well organised and stay cool when working under tight deadlines
• You are incredibly driven, hungry and learn from your mistakes
• You believe in what we are doing and are truly passionate about disrupting finance
• Native/Fluent in one of the following languages is a plus: Hungarian, Lithuanian, Greek, Czech, Russian, Swedish, Dutch, Bulgarian, Croatian, Latvian, Slovakian, Danish, Norwegian, Finnish, Turkish, Japanese, Chinese, Brazilian Portuguese.
• Experience in working in tech companies and/or fast-paced environment is a plus.




Salary circa 2000 Euros' per month. Negotiable on experience.
A LITTLE ABOUT US
We believe that there are better ways for people to control their money. Easier, fairer ways.
Revolut started in 2015 with card transactions abroad without rubbish exchange rates or hidden fees. We’ve since added business accounts, vaults, insurance and even access to cryptocurrency exposure.
We reached 10 million customers as we rolled into 2020 and we’re adding another million every quarter.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
From employee 1 to employee 1400, you will be slotting into a global team that shares a number of traits.
You can work autonomously and take ownership. We thrive with the space and responsibility to solve problems.
You operate best without lots of bureaucracy. We don’t hide behind fancy job titles or clunky processes ‘because that’s how things are done’.
You approach work in a logical way. We are not afraid to make mistakes but we use data and logic to backup decisions and improve understanding.
And you share our mission to improve people’s relationship with their money.

THE BENEFITS
• Competitive salary
• Biannual equity bonuses
• All the latest tech you need
• Skip the commute and work from home once a week
• Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
• Pension plan
• Private health insurance


Please only submit an application for one posting.

About Citco

Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with more than 7,000 staff across 80 offices worldwide. With more than $1 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients’ needs.

About the Team & Business Line:

For over 75 years Citco has developed an ethos of service excellence and partnership in corporate fiduciary and administration that our clients rely upon. Through our global office network we provide a full suite of corporate administrative services to set up, administer and maintain corporate entities throughout their life cycle.

Working with our Global Subsidiary Governance Services team, you will work with multinationals, corporates and private clients to provide critical support that helps them meet the increasing regulatory and compliance requirements that shape the industry.

Your Role:
You will prepare various statistical report
You will distribute Citco invoices to the clients
You will handle business partners invoices in complex situations
You will provide service to Operations team’s clients
You will perform various administrative complex assignments per requests of clients servicing teams
About You:
You have college or university degree (can be fresh graduate or last year student available to work full-time)
You have very good computers skills (Microsoft Office packages)
You are fluent in English (written and spoken)
You are flexible, proactive and attentive to details team player with excellent communication skills
Our Benefits

Your wellbeing is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.

Who are we?

TransferGo is an international fintech brand, offering online money transfers across the world with high speed, low fees and no hassle. We’re a multilingual bunch of people, working from offices in London, Vilnius, Kaunas, Berlin, Istanbul and Warsaw – and we’re still growing!

At TransferGo, we’re on a mission to make moving money globally as simple and easy as sending a text. Engineering team plays a critical role in shaping the way we create the best technical solutions and, to make sure we’re doing that in the best way possible, we’re now looking for a talented Data Engineer to work in our Infra team.

You’ll report to the Tech Lead.

Here’s what you’ll be doing:


Contribute to building and fostering a data-centric culture across the whole company
Create and maintain optimal data architecture (covering operational data stores, data lake, data warehouse and data pipelines)
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of relational/non-relational data sources
Contribute to building analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Create data tools for product analytics team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems
Requirements

Here’s what we’d love from our new Data Engineer:
Advanced working knowledge and experience working with relational / non-relational data stores
Experience designing, building and optimizing data pipelines and workflows
Hands-on scripting experience Python would be an advantage
Hands-on experience with AWS data-centric services (RDS, Redshift, Glue) would be an advantage
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
A track record of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
What we believe

At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way.

We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!

Benefits

Some of our best benefits are:
Being part of an exciting and growing fintech startup community
A competitive salary package
Private health insurance (after 6 months of employment)
Unlimited paid holiday
Flexible working hours, with the opportunity to work from home
The opportunity to learn with a company that is rapidly growing, along with a guaranteed training budget of €1,000
A friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment (pet-friendly office, team events, tasty snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings, a fun budget and events)
Monthly salary from 3000 € to 5000€ (gross) depending on the level of experience.

Wix’s product storytellers. As passionate advocates for our users, we create clear, eye-level copy that shapes how people experience our products. Wix UX writers own the entire content process, and collaborate closely with product managers, UX designers and developers to create outstanding products. Guided by the Wix tone and voice, we craft compelling copy to get the right message across and help our users succeed.

You are:

A native-level English speaker and writing professional with 2+ years’ relevant web experience. You’re passionate about creating simple, clear copy, as well as being tech savvy and up to date on trends in UX and web content. You’re highly organized and able to manage tasks independently, but you can also work effectively with a local and remote team.

You’re comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, are a critical thinker and have an eye for detail. You can also travel occasionally, and love a good challenge (or 3)!

As a UX writer, you will:
Write clear, creative UX content in the Wix tone and voice.
Conduct extensive product research based on usability sessions, support tickets, competitor analysis and more.
Own every stage of the content cycle, from brainstorming on initial wireframes to shipping perfect copy.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, UX designers and other stakeholders across the company and in different offices worldwide.
Juggle multiple projects at once, while prioritizing your tasks and meeting tight deadlines.
Coordinate the localization process for our global audience (18 languages and counting!).
Please send CV in English.

Job Title: Intern - Finance and customer service departments
Job Description:
Intern - Finance and customer service departments


Vilnius

Reference No:
15392

What's the role?

We’re looking for an intern/ assistant who will ensure support for our finance and customer service departments.

Who is Hilti?

If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service.

With some 30,000 people in more than 120 countries, which we’re looking to expand, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career.

What does the role involve?

Your areas of responsibility will be connected with documentation classification - system creation and document organization. You will perform balance confirmations and send reminders to customers. An important part of your job will be related to preparation and registration of customer cooperation agreements and support provision for Hilti Lithuania customer service department - arranging received invoices by folders and sending invoices to our customers.

We have more than 200,000 interactions with our customers every day. It’s how we get to know their businesses, understand their needs and develop the precise products and services that will help them.

What do we offer?

We will provide you opportunity to develop during the internship and professional, dynamic and supportive colleagues.

Why should you apply?

We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative and more productive team.

What you need is:

Attention to details
Fluent Lithuanian, good English and/or Russian language knowledge
Enthusiasm and orientation on achievement of goals and tasks assign
Pro-active engagement in the tasks to be performed

Tempted to apply or find out more - send your application.

At TransferGo we are on a mission to make moving money globally as simple and easy as sending a text. We aim to make life easier for anyone sending money abroad by removing the processes and fees that traditional banking institutions have.

We are a fast-growing FinTech company with an international team of more than 170 employees, great product and service available in more than 50 countries, with the goal to provide the best customer service every step of the way.

At the moment we are offering an exciting opportunity for a Quality Assurance engineer to join our QA team and work for a well-known FinTech startup in our office in Vilnius. We operate in a high paced, collaborative and innovative environment where like-minded individuals come together to form great teams. If you have the talent and desire to learn and deliver then please get in touch with us.

The role:

You will be working within the technical department of the company running the latest products and features on some of the busiest and most successful consumer facing web and mobile apps the market has to offer. The team you will be joining is nimble and creative with the power to shape this company's technology and product roadmap and your input will shape testing. As Senior QA Engineer you will not just work with our product's test automation, but also work closely with our QA Guild and be able to shape our testing processes as well as touch the latest tech trends.

About you:

Passionate about trying and using trendy websites and apps
Excellent communicator
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to work autonomously
Ability to automate boring stuff
High levels of initiative
Passion for Agility and working in an Agile environment
Mobile app native development awareness
Requirements

The ideal candidate:
3+ years of experience in software testing (both manual and automation)
Our automation is built on Puppeteer/Cucumber/Appium/WebriverIO and NodeJS - we do not expect you to know all of this. Ability to learn fast is key.
Passion for learning the latest and greatest QA methods
Knowledge in any of the following programming languages JavaScript (NodeJS), Python, PHP would be an advantage
Knowledge in any of the following: Selenium, Cucumber, Jenkins, Automated Testing
Practical knowledge in: WEB/API/Mobile automation, Cucumber, CI/CD
Quality focused, but have business acumen which enables pragmatism
Likes a challenge, and enjoys working hard in a fun, casual working environment
What we believe

At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way.

We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!

Benefits

We offer:
Being part of extremely exciting and growing Fintech startup community
You will spend 3 days per month learning and innovating.
Competitive salary package.
Private health insurance (after 6 months of employment).

What you can expect from us:


Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer.

About Us

FAST INVEST platform is a state of the art financial tool. Our engine helps society to build passive income streams and to achieve financial freedom in the short term. FAST INVEST has an intention to inspire people and be always ready to pursue bigger goals. The concept is based on the symbiosis of a responsible act, altruistic notion, and academic discipline. This particular harmony builds a broader context and awareness of our presence in our society. To be a part of the community is a unique inclusion, and it is something bigger than you alone. Responsible citizens of society - this is the key attribute of luxury.

Working Environment

We live to create a better working culture where everyone can develop and use their best skills. We are currently on a mission to find finance and data nerd, who would contribute towards our united goal to achieve even bigger results!

About You

You do not come to work for the sake of just working. You are passionate about what you do. You live in a world of numbers and there can’t be enough to excel tables for you. Numbers do not bore you, it excites you, and most importantly – you can see past them.

What you'll be doing ⚡️
To work at the intersection of technology to automate as much of finance as possible.
To support the Finance Manager in the coordination of the closure of accounts and production of the annual reports.
Assisting with the statutory compliance for our Spanish entity, ensure accounts are filed in accordance with local compliance.
Review the cash flow forecast on a monthly basis and monitor our cash flow weekly.
Ensuring that all day to day accounting is carried out in an accurate and timely manner, including month-end postings, invoicing, payroll, VAT declarations.

Your Professional Background
Good knowing of statutory compliance of Lithuania.
Experience working in Fintech or Tech company.
Experience working with a large amount of data, building various reports.
Experience with MySQL.
Experience working with lending company portfolio/risk management would be considered as a plus.

We Offer
Professional development budget.
Possibility to work with international projects and go across our offices in Europe.
Work in a startup.
A young and friendly team of colleagues of diverse nationalities, life experiences, family statuses.
A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible.
Many fun team events, office parties, and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues.
Fancy Office in Kaunas city center.

ABOUT US
FAST INVEST is a P2P Investment platform where investing is made easy. Recently, our company was recognized by The Silicon Review among the Top 50 Fastest Growing Companies of the Year 2019. 545% growth of the investment volume, more than 41k customers from 55 countries.
We are committed to attracting and retaining the best team of talented professionals, and to create a better working culture where everyone can develop and use their best skills in the FinTech industry. By retaining leading talent anchored in a culture of integrity, we can operate according to our guiding principles and ensure excellent service and a healthy team environment.

ABOUT YOU
You do not come to work for the sake of just working. You are passionate about what you do. Effective strategic, operational, and leadership support to the team to ensure the highest standards of operational delivery. You feel comfortable in a fast-moving environment.
You will lead us through strategic financial planning and risk assessment, including periodic forecasts, reviews, and annual budgeting. As our Head of Finance, you will collaborate with our leadership team to advise on all financial matters.

YOUR EXPERIENCE & SKILLS
You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in finance or a related field.
You have experience working at Fintech or Tech company.
A real enthusiasm for commercial, financial analysis, and an ability to develop KPI dashboards.
Experience working within a senior finance position for a minimum of 3 years.
High technology knowledge skills.
Your English is fluent (both written and verbal).
You are loyal, trustworthy, and very confidential.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Work autonomously and lead in an organization.
To build and develop modern, technology-based Financial Policies & Procedures.
Produce comprehensive, technology-based financial models to identify risks & opportunities and track growth plans across the group.
Partner with the CEO to bring the strategic vision of the business to life.
To build a technology-based system for cash flow control & financial risk management.
To comply with local financial regulations (UK, ES, LT, EE, PL) and excellent knowledge of IFRS.
To prepare reports for the financial regulator and other institutions.

WE OFFER
Create the environment and process that enables highly effective teams to deliver the best that they can.
Work in a Fintech with a growing customer base and an exciting product roadmap.
International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment.
Flexible working hours and a special attention to work-life balance.
A friendly team of colleagues of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible.
Many fun team events, office parties, and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues.
Fancy office in Kaunas city center.

Wix’s mobile team. We develop the Wix mobile app, enabling our users to manage their business from the convenience of their mobile phone, anytime and anywhere. We create fun, beautiful products that have a meaningful impact on millions of people around the world.

We are also a prominent player in the React Native community and have created many popular libraries and infrastructure tools for the React Native ecosystem.

We’re looking for a passionate team player to join our growing team.

You are:
An ambitious and creative student with a talent and passion for coding (mobile app development in particular).
Team player with a positive attitude
Passionate about mobile applications and mobile development
A tenacious self-starter and determined problem solver
A student in your 2nd or 3rd year of studying computer science (or similar) at an accredited college or university.
Able to work for at least 80 hours a month, with flexibility during exam periods. Ability to work full-time would be a bonus.
Bonus points if you have experience with:
Open source project development. Have a personal project to show us? That’s a big plus!
React and React Native
Android/iOS development
JavaScript frameworks
As a Mobile Developer, you will:


Work with React Native code base
Manage and complete tasks using automated testing techniques, continuous integration and modern development processes.
Handle fixes and develop new features for our mobile application.
Continuously challenge your knowledge of how to scale mobile development.
